description: Whats better than a sword with magic imbued in it?
You're probably famillar with enchantments on regular tools, but they work slightly diffrently on tetra tools. Enchantment affects are still the same, but watch out for /b/Magic Capacity/b/.

/b/Enchantments/b/ consume /b/Magic Capacity/b/ when applied. Exceeding the capacity makes the module /c/magically unstable/c/. /6/Repairs/6/ to the module will cost /b/experience/b/, and /6/modifications/6/ to it may /c/destabilize/c/ the enchantments.

/b/Magic Capacity/b/ is based on the materials used in the module. More /b/enchantable/b/ materials grant higher capacity. Some materials may be /6/Stablizing/6/ and will increase the capacity of the major modules.

Enchantments are /6/bound to a single module/6/. This means you can avoid destablization by spreading out enchantments between difrent modules. However, if you /6/replace the module/6/ with enchantments, /c/they will be lost/c/. Other non-enchanted modules can be swapped without worry.
